data.title: Great old bar
data.text: Went with our niece and her hubby. Said she always gets the Frito pie cuz it makes her HAPPY. Great chunks of beef in a spicy chili sauce. The real deal compared to the beans with ground beef chili I grew up on in the Northwest. The bar is so filled with history and character. Would like to be there for live music. We walked around the area afterwards and enjoyed seeing the bakery, too.

data.title: Good Food, but WATCH YOUR CREDIT CARD BILL
data.text: My wife and I went here back in March on our way through town. Read the reviews and decided to check out. We both enjoyed our food, chili and sandwich, but they padded the credit card charge for $3 that WE HAD NOT AUTHORIZED! Would not return to a place that would do that! Not worth my time to dispute with CC company, but thought others should be made aware.

owner_response.author: PhoenixSaloon, Owner at Phoenix Saloon, responded to this review
owner_response.text: The Phoenix Saloon absolutely does not add any unauthorized charges to customers credit card bills. If this customer had a charge he did not recognize he could have notified us and we would have taken care of any error or explained any misunderstanding. We pride ourselves on our honesty and integrity. Frustratingly, waiting eight months before commenting makes it difficult for us to ascertain the precise details of this transaction.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great New Braunfels Bar
data.text: This is by far the best bar in New Braunfels. They have a fantastic beer selection, with multiple craft beers from the local hill country community, as well as top shelf liquors. The also have the best burger and chili in town! If you like live music you are definitely in luck most nights of the week.

data.title: Fun spot to bring your friends and family
data.text: This bar and restaurant is a fun place to gather with friends and family. The menu is typical pub food but enjoyable. Once the band starts playing on Friday and Saturday nights...it gets loud!

data.title: Fun Atmosphere and Chili Favorite
data.text: Several friends and family members met up for an evening of chili and entertainment on a Saturday night.  Very casual atmosphere with several large tables and even a long bar with a large variety of beers on tap.  No wait staff for initial ordering so all drinks and food orders are taken at the bar; no worries though...they do bring the orders to the table.  Large projector screen with live football and music entertainment later with a local fire station bagpipe processional drop in.  Downstairs offers a quiet corner which once was a working icebox with darts and a pool table.  Good food and a noted focus on the chili.  A bit loud at times but it simply adds to the charm of this fun local treasure.

data.title: Great Little Bar & Restaurant
data.text: My family and I took a Sunday trip exploring New Braunfels, TX and while doing so we had dinner here. It is a historical landmark and has been on Diners, Drive Ins, & Dives with Guy Fieri. They are famous for their TX Chili. We all ordered the chili, my son had the normal one shot chili, I had the double shot chili, and my wife the Ring of Fire Chili. The chili is amazing however my son could not eat his and I could not eat mine, although it is delicious be very careful if you have a hard time with spicy whatsoever. The one shot chili is already pretty spicy and the double shot is over the top spicy. The Ring of Fire forget about it. I ended up eating my sons chili, My wife ate mine and hers as she eats ghost peppers without an issue. The Bar and Restaurant has live music and it is a cool little place to just hang out and grab a drink or dinner. I will be back.

data.title: Good music venue
data.text: Good laid back place to eat, drink and listen to live music.  Crowd wasn't too crowded for a Sat. with good live music.  We came early to eat prior to the band performing.  All ordering for food and drinks are at the bar.  All in all the food was pretty good.  Although, if you order the chili cheese fries expect to wait...a long time.  Apparently, it takes the most time to cook.  All meat is sirloin chunks.  I ordered before most of my group and got my food after everybody had finished up their burgers, etc.  I kept asking the staff if it was coming out as no one was updating me on my order which was annoying.  I would come again, but definitely order the chili cheese fries (it was good though).  They also have a small area downstairs with some games; etc.  Ask the staff about the history of the building and the downstairs.

data.title: Great Chili - love it hot
data.text: Tried a local beer and had the ring of fire chili- nice and hot & very tasty -  might be a tad hot for some but hey you only live once

data.title: Unique But Not Great
data.text:
The Pheonix is what it is.  If you are hungry, you have to wait in the crowd at the bar until a bartender notices you, so that you can order your food.  They then hand you a number card which you put on your table.  In a while, someone brings your order to you.  If you don't expect anything more from their "Whataburger" system of service, it's just fine. 

My wife and I stopped in before a show at the Brauntex last night. The place has character.  You can sit there and imagine what it was like in the 1800's.   The food is ok.  The sweet potato fries were really good, but they served blue cheese to dip them in.  Weird choice and kind of yucky. I would imagine most people just put it aside.  I had a Phoenix burger.  It was OK - mostly bun- but nothing to rave about.  

As a local, I can't imagine coming here for dinner on a date again. Maybe lunch if I'm downtown. But it is a great place to pop in for a beer or to meet friends for a drink.

data.title: "We don't serve fast food, we serve good food as fast as we can"
data.text:
That is their motto above, and the sure do live up to it. 

Know that you're going to be waiting a while for your order, so order some drinks and relax with your group of friends or family. We went on a Sunday afternoon and it was busy the entire time with families and couples. 

On first impression it does not look like a family restaurant, but our children had a great time. It's a place that loves that it's been around forever and has a saloon feel inside with dark wood and old tables and chairs. It makes no excuses for what it is: simply a real old, historic place that has awesome food. 

Beer & Alcohol: A wide variety of local brews on draught and tons of liquor behind the bar. 

Burgers: my friend's burger was huge and looked delicious. 

Hot Dogs: I was first dismayed by the $7.00 price tag, thinking, "this better be one good hot dog". Images of Sonic-like dogs flashed through my brain. However, I was blown away by a gigantic bigger-than-a-kielbasa-sized dog split down the middle and grilled (with marks!) Atop an equally large and, you guessed it, grilled bun. The fries are wedges and are salted, peppered, and seasoned deliciously. 

Awesome food, don't go with a time limit.

data.title: Sit At the Bar
data.text: OK, I live in New Braunfels and there are many restaurants to choose from.  The Phoenix Saloon is one of my favorites.  My husband and I like to go around 5pm.  We sit at the bar, drink cold draft beer, listen to the small afternoon musicians and, best of all, eat a hamburger with sweet potato fries!  We love it.  The bartenders are friendly and the music is not too loud.  I highly recommend the Phoenix.

data.title: True Texas Landmark
data.text: The Phoenix Saloon is the embodiment of old west charm from the pressed tin ceilings to the original hardwood floor. Lots of local and Texas beers on tap make it a great place to duck in and cool off from the hot summer sun. They have good food and live music, if there was a rollaway bed I'd never have to leave! A landmark and cornerstone of New Braunfels.

data.title: Great sweet potato fries and chili
data.text: Sweet potato wedges are baked with cracked black pepper and salt. Delicious. The blue cheese dipping sauce that came with them tasted more like mayo with lemon. Fries are better by themselves. Chili was meaty and great and was served with a wedge of delicious cornbread. Bar here has tons of local beer. Live music is a plus.

data.title: Okay food, okay service, good selection of beers
data.text: We went here for lunch. The food was average, maybe a little above. There was a nice selection of beers, including some local brews. The chili was OK, and Hubs said it reminded him of Chili's, only meatier. I didn't think it was at all spicy, and I'm pretty wimpy.

data.title: Great place and even better chilli!
data.text: Went with my family during a quick visit to New Braunfels. It's near the historic center; really good for a walk afterwards. We had the best and spiciest chilli we've had to date. Their beer selection was pretty good. 👍

data.title: Great Fun!
data.text:
We went late right before the kitchen closed.  The food was delicious!  We had burgers.
The hill country bar and grill delivers with it Texas feel.  The live music added to the ambience.  Great date night.  We will go back

data.title: Great place for live Music, cool history, friendly staff
data.text:
I've gone several times over the last few years. They have live music several times a week. Fun place to go and the staff is very welcoming. 

The place has a cool history dating back to the late 1800s. The original building was a small fraction of what it is now. There's some cool historical shots online through the years. The place has some fascinating connections to the prohibition years and even underground tunnels conected to other historical buildings. 

The chili is a touch overrated  (way too much chili powder) and the cornbread was a touch dry. Though I hear the burger is strong! I'll try that on my next visit. 

Stop by for a drink, catch some tunes, and chat up the staff, you won't be disappointed.

data.title: Now I understand
data.text: I've live in new braunfels for 2 years and have always wanted to try the Phoenix. I've heard from friends and family it was overrated and not a good place to go. Now I understand why they said this. My boyfriend and I went @ 3:30 on Saturday. When we arrived it was clear they were in the beginning of a huge rush, so we ordered quickly. We got a Frito pie and a chicken sandwich. We each ordered a cocktail and began waiting. We knew it would be longer than usual, but we had no idea we would be receiving our food @ 5:05. That's right, an hour and 35 minutes. I had to go back to work at 5 pm so @4:50 I asked for it Togo. In the time we were waiting we received one refill on our drinks and were never spoken to again. My boyfriend then waited for the food while I went back to work. And what was in the boxes? This ice cream truck excuse of a Frito pie, without the jalepenos or sour cream I paid for, and no cheese!!! My chicken sandwich came with a bag of chips. Now I will mention the manager didn't charge us for the food and took off our second round of drinks. He never came to apologize. No one did. It was insane. No one cared.

data.title: Cool bar with eats
data.text: Phoenix has been around in various forms for a long time. Decent selection of beers. Good bartenders. Outside seating on sidewalk. Live music. Great chili and burgers

data.title: Cool Place, Excellent Chili
data.text: I saw this place on Daytripper tv show and wanted to try it so we made the trek on Mothers Day for a late lunch.  The place and history is really neat, you do feel like you have stepped back in time to a degree.  There was live music, a little loud but very good.  They are known for their Chili which is made with sirloin and you can order "shots" to make it hotter.  I of course ordered a double shot, everyone else a single.  Then you get to pick toppings.  The Chili is served with Skillet corn bread which was so good we ordered extra!  To top it off they have a really large old bar complete with a bunch of draft beer.  My husband ordered a Guiness and swore it was the best he ever had.  Delicious food, neat place, good music.  We will return and this time with a car load of friends!
